A careless admin leaked the high bits of their RSA private key. Recover the message from the encrypted note: 4351298166326628098876079845021291066568825918627869603675062594680516610663328453412856232289009049879153847202592602843557864305820963378335778438529581

The flag format is flag{...}
n=5201816598624867148226690116452831032993945633981125506246454228430319823963360566652543419735516068109476989400780765649221347483753417453038590107679899, e=2954439173217823184078170154439602128161916454294648659858400720203992351318292330570055546570420102693122104127925838558836979244980938008242676805682049, partial_p=13166092611076032608

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{pexu424a}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4351298166326628098876079845021291066568825918627869603675062594680516610663328453412856232289009049879153847202592602843557864305820963378335778438529581
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5201816598624867148226690116452831032993945633981125506246454228430319823963360566652543419735516068109476989400780765649221347483753417453038590107679899, e=2954439173217823184078170154439602128161916454294648659858400720203992351318292330570055546570420102693122104127925838558836979244980938008242676805682049, partial_p=13166092611076032608
extra_info: p=82644902777247119249086315877090087730635001822817534045010039460587813144797, q=62941771649793431335800176162755958134241516202679731113111146494289139140567, Ï†(n)=5201816598624867148226690116452831032993945633981125506246454228430319823963214979978116379184931181617437143354915889131195850218595296267083713155394536
subtype: partial_key_exposure
